_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Board of Directors, management and employees of Heartland Co-op are committed to the prevention of

any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared

to work with the local fire department, County Emergency Management, the Iowa Department of Natural

Resources and/or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the public and the

environment.

The primary activity at the facility is the distribution of products to farmers. The fertilizer product, anhydrous

ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.

Anhydrous ammonia is stored in tanks designed for this purpose.

This facility follows the provisions of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 20 CFR

1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia" and our state regulations covering anhydrous

ammonia.

There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia during the last five years that have caused

any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, has there been any

accidental releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage, or environmental

damage.

The felicity has a written Emergency Action Plan in accordance with OSHA 29 CFR 1910.38. We do not plan to

have our employees respond to a major release. If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at our

facility, the response action is to evacuate the area of the spill and call 911 and all applicable emergency

response numbers listed in our Emergency Action Plan.

Safety improvement is an on-going process at this facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the

conditions of the facility. There are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding the storage or

the use of anhydrous ammonia for implementation at this time.
